intro: Trichomanes cupressoides, commonly known as the clubmoss, is a primitive vascular plant belonging to the family Huperfamily. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, scale-like leaves that form a cushion-like structure. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically clustered in dense clusters on the underside of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Trichomanes cupressoides is an important component of many temperate and tropical ecosystems.
